feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Control the import of custom logic
entry.content:
Hi SAP,

Currently, we have enabled the sales order approval process, and there is custom logic set up in the D system as follows. However, we want to test other processes in the T system without affecting the P system.

Since the transfer from T to P seems to be automatic, we would like to confirm if there are alternative methods to assist with adjustments so that the T system does not require approval, but the P system still does. Thank you.

Custom logic:

if salesdocument-sddocumentcategory = 'C'.
salesdocapprovalreason = 'ZOR1'.
endif.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Can Custom Fields be added in the Create Outgoing Invoices app?
entry.content:
Dear SAP,

I have a question about Custom Fields.

I want to add custom fields on the Create Outgoing Invoices app.

Is it possible to add extended items to this application?

If possible, what Business Context should be selected?

Best regards


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud / Problem with the Migration of Contact Persons
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
i have a question about the best way to migrate a complex structure of contact persons. Our goul is that the migrated business partners have their associated contact persons in the "contacts" section in the general view of the app "Manage Business Partner Master Data" (compare screenshot). 

The issue is, that there are a few Business Partners that share the same contact person. If we only use the Migration Cockpit and the "customer" migration object, we would, from our understanding, create the same contact person multiple times if we tried to enter them in the contact person section of that migration template, because it always creates a new contact person for every entry. 
Given that, the next logical step would be to migrate the contact persons and the other business partners seperatly and then fix the issue with mass maintenace after that.
My question is, are there apps to mass maintain this information and if so, how is the process ? Or is this a limitation of the Public Cloud and we need to do this manually ?

Best regards
Lukas

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud: Outbound Del. and Inspection Lot in different plants to send Quality Certificate
entry.content:
Hi everyone!

In SAP S/HANA Cloud Public Edition I need to send the quality certificate from one plant in the outbound delivery but the correspondent inspection lot is in a different plant. Both outbound delivery and inspection lot have the same lot number.

Is there any standard way to do this ?

Thanks in advance.

André

entry.title: How to handle tax-included items
entry.content:
Hi Dear Experts,

Regarding customer requirements, there are cases where tax-exclusive and tax-inclusive prices are differentiated by client.
Under normal order processing, calculations are typically performed on a tax-exclusive basis. However, does the Public system provide a method to process tax-inclusive amounts?
We would appreciate your guidance on this matter.

Although detailed information is unavailable, I have learned that in the on-premise version, tax-inclusive prices can be handled using the price determination table.

Please suggest.

Thank you very much.Best Regards!

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Finance SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Sales SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: Does PULLIC CLOUD support connecting to corresponding banks for payment in the following countries：
entry.content:
US- BAC
Singapore-DBS
Japan-HSBC

Or where can I find out in which countries and which banks can connect to public clouds for direct bank enterprise payments?

entry.title: About Line Item Validation
entry.content:
Hi all,
I"d like to know more about line item validation performed in the data monitor.

1. What data table is being checked?
The help documentation for the configuration activity states, "Accounting: Checks line items from accounting table ACDOCA."

However, the Help Portal states, "Run line item validation to check if errors exist on posting level blank and 0C."
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/90c07e91c7a64f328be3fd6b48955b13/b3ab8186216b4e729f6901069dc6c96b.html?locale=en-US

Does the "posting level blank and 0C" statement mean that the data table being checked is ACDOCU, not ACDOCA?

2. Regarding validation rules
The Help Portal states, "This task or tasks identify any errors or warnings from validation rules. These rules have the business context GR Journal Entry Item and are maintained in the Manage Substitution/Validation Rules - Group Journal Entries app."

However, even after adding validation rules, they don"t work with Line Item Validation.
Why is this?
(The added validation rules work when entering group journal entries.)
(Validation rule: AmountInLocalCurrency=10)

entry.title: Asset transactions: journal entry tracing for settlement variant is not displaying data.
entry.content:
While checking the Asset transactions app, it appears the Predecessor Journal entry and Investment WBS origin appear to be empty for those AuC's. Please see attachments with screenshots: display line items in G/L (shows settlements) and asset transaction results.

entry.title: Custom Application Job Template not visible in Application Jobs App
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I'm an ABAP developer working on the S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and I'm facing a frustrating issue.

I've followed the standard process for a custom application job:

  1. Created an ABAP class with the business logic.
  2. Created the custom Job Catalog Entry.
  3. Created the Application Job Template.

However, when I go to the "Application Jobs" app, my new template isn't visible in the list. I've already checked that the Application Job Template is configured correctly and published.

Has anyone experienced a similar problem with custom jobs in the S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition? Could there be a missing configuration step or authorization that I'm overlooking?

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated!

Kind Regards,

Marcelo Romeiro

entry.title: Profit centre not inherited to all lines of a document despite being a Doc Splitting Characteristic?
entry.content:
Profit Centre is included as a Document Splitting Characteristic by default (though not as zero balancing characteristic), so we expect that PC will be inherited to all lines of the document from the Revenue Line or Expense Line.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud: Quality Certificate doesn't print the mean value results of all inspections points
entry.content:
Hi, everyone! 

Regarding SAP S4/HANA Cloud Edition how can I print the mean value of all inspections point in Quality Certificate for a inspection lot created by production (for example) with inspection control type 03 or 04 ? 

In CBC configuration "Define Origin of Characteristic Result Values" I created a new entry:

Besides this configuration I have created a "Certificate Profile" related with the previous configuration:

Even with this configuration quality certificate is printing only the result of the last inspection point. Is there anything that I missing ?

Thanks in advance.

André

entry.title: New FI document type and number range interval in S4HC
entry.content:
Dear Cloud Public product experts,

I would like to ask the expert advice regarding "Change settings for Assigning Number Ranges to Document types" on What's new page 2502.
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/ee9ee0ca4c3942068ea584d2f929b5b1/9ec39346cb0f402f944409ac7c8f0250.html?locale=en-US&version=2502.00

Query:

  1.  Which number range intervals is allowed to newly create and assign to custom document types?
    I understand that some number ranges such as S0 and W0 are SAP-reserved object. But we cannot see the relevant number range intervals for them in the Starter system as of 2508. We are not sure which document number range intervals can be used for custom-own document types?
  2. Which document type ID is allowed to define as custom document types ?
    I need to know which naming areas of document type are SAP reserved ones,

Thank you for your support & Kindly Regards,
Ai Takahashi

entry.title: Service Entry Sheet by value
entry.content:
Good morning, support team,

We need to perform service receipts with very specific amounts. We have tried adjusting the unit percentage, but it does not yield the same result.

I have an example where a purchase order was created for the amount of 4,762,414.8125, and six service receipts were made for the following values:

  • 580,357.67

  • 476,241.07

  • 638,392.86

  • 714,285.71

  • 1,266,573.21

  • 1,086,564.29

If we apply a rule of three to extract the percentage for each receipt, the resulting values do not match due to decimal differences.

Is it possible to receive by amount instead of by quantity?

entry.title: Custom CDS - Modification After Publishing - S4 Public cloud
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, we are working with a CDS view that serves as a primary data source and is referenced by multiple other CDS views.

Now, I need to make some modifications in the join conditions of this base CDS. However, when attempting this, the system asks me to first delete the references from the dependent CDS views before making changes. This would result in a significant impact on our current setup.

Is there any way to modify the base CDS join conditions without having to remove all the references from the dependent CDS views?

Additionally, since we are implementing this for a 100-client setup, I would like to know if it is possible to access and modify this CDS view in Eclipse. If yes, could you please guide me on how to proceed?

Thanks in advance for your support!

entry.title: Error eDocument Cockpit
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I hope you are doing very well. Today I have a question regarding an Electronic Invoicing integration that I am developing. I have S4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC EDITION, Integration Suite as middleware, and EFACT as the electronic invoicing provider. What happens is that from S4 an XML is generated that will be sent to EFACT, but before sending it I need to transform the XML into the structure they expect and then send it to them in a file. This part is not the issue, I just mention it to give context.

The problem is that when I trigger the process from the eDocument Cockpit, I get these errors. However, if I check in Integration Suite, it shows as completed and I can see the response returned by the electronic provider. Has any of you experts experienced a similar situation?

Regards.

entry.title: Mass download of pdf's and emails generated in Production which have been issued to customers
entry.content:
Hello,

Can you please let me know how to mass download all the generated pdf's and emails in Production system for customers. 

We want to be able to mass extract/ download all the created invoices, dunning notices or other business process output documents sent to the customer from Production system.

For example-

1. We can see the pdf's and emails generated in Display Dunning Notice within Display Dunning History App.

We want to mass download all the generated Dunning notices including pdf's and emails. Can you please let me know how to do this is production.

2. In Display Billing Documents App we can view the Billing Invoices generated.

We want to be able to mass download all the processed Billing Invoices from here.

3. Similarly for other business processes which generated documents issued to customer.

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.
